data: The sun of an August afternoon, 1782, was yet blazing upon the rude palisades and equally rude cabins of one of the principal stations in Lincoln county, when a long train of emigrants, issuing from the southern forest, wound its way over the clearings, and among the waving maize-fields that surrounded the settlement, and approached the chief gate of its enclosure.
palisades | cabins | southern forest | maize-fields | chief gate
Nick of the Woods; Or, Adventures of Prairie Life
